text: Donald Robert Laz (May 17, 1929 – February 21, 1996) was an American pole vaulter. He won a silver medal at the 1952 Olympics and a bronze at the 1955 Pan American Games. Domestically he held the NCAA title in 1951 and shared the AAU title in 1953. After retiring from competitions he worked as an architect in Champaign, Illinois, and retired after suffering a stroke. In January 1951 Laz married Nancy June Barber:File:Don Laz with wife 1951.jpg. They had a son Doug, who also became a competitive pole vaulter. == References== Category:1929 births Category:1996 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Chicago Category:American male pole vaulters Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1952 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic track and field athletes of the United States Category:Olympic silver medalists for the United States in track and field Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1955 Pan American Games Category:Pan American Games bronze medalists for the United States Category:Medalists at the 1952 Summer Olympics Category:Pan American Games medalists in athletics (track and field)
title: Don Laz
